meanings.definition: Excessively sharp or keen in perception or intellect.
meanings.sent1: The overacute student noticed every tiny detail in the painting.
meanings.sent2: She had an overacute sense of smell, able to detect even the faintest scents.
meanings.sent3: The detective's overacute observation skills helped him solve the case quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her overacute hearing picked up the slightest rustling in the bushes.
meanings.sent5: The overacute chef could taste the subtlest flavors in the dish.

meanings.definition: To make excessively sharp or keen in perception or intellect.
meanings.sent1: He tried to overacute his senses by practicing mindfulness.
meanings.sent2: The teacher aimed to overacute her students' critical thinking skills.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally overacuted the microscope, causing the image to blur.
meanings.sent4: The hypnotist's words seemed to overacute the audience's focus.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk overacuted the team's determination to win.
